title: we ever gonna get league of legends back?
body: you know the game where its a battle back and forth for about 30 minutes coming down to 1 or two team fights or baron and elder contests? cause I'm honestly tired of games being decided by the first few kills or first tower or fucking first blood to some extent like riot you really have out done yourself you wanted faster and its very unsatisfying but maybe those new players you wanted to attract think its fun so I guess good for you, you got exactly what you wanted

replies.body:
I miss my favorite game, I guess we just need to accept this is league now and just quit.

Tencent-GC-LOL sucks balls :/

Tencent owns 90% of Riot since... 2011? 

Stop blaming Tencent for everything and be real. They just bought the whole “Riot Games” but they owned a good part of it already. They’re not involved in gameplay stuff so it’s totally Riot’s fault if the game is like this.

Meh, even those shitty and questionable changes to BE/skins/loot crates are Riot’s business and Tencent has little to nothing to do with it.

Riot was completely taken over by Tencent in 2015, ever since then, all major problems in the gameplay that people complain about it started to happen.

Although Tencent brought some shares of Riot games in 2011, they only acquire the whole company in 2015, it's when they decide to stop being a passive owner to introduce changes to the game to shape it toward their own view of a profitable game.

#STOP SPREADING MISINFORMATION AS AN ARGUMENT

(TENCENT OWNS RIOT 2015)
https://www.polygon.com/2015/12/16/10326320/riot-games-now-owned-entirely-by-tencent

(LIST OF MASSIVE CHANGES TENCENT MADE AFTER THE TAKEOVER)

* BUFF MARKSMEN

* MATCHMAKING SCRAMBLER

* RANDOM ITEM DROP "KEY FRAGMENTS + BOXES"

* DYNAMIC QUEUE + QUEUE TIMES BROKEN

https://www.polygon.com/2015/11/4/9669642/league-of-legends-update-alpha-2016

(TENCENT BUYS SHARES OF RIOT 2011)
https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2011-02-04/tencent-said-to-be-near-deal-to-buy-riot-games-for-more-than-350-million

(GHOSTCRAWLER HIRED BY RIOT 2014)

I believe they sht themselves after blizzard announced new revolutionally mmr system where individual performance is taken into ranking points and mmr. For now it was put off because there was a bug with placements and they need to fix it but ita back soon. As we k ow games in hots are quite short. Average 20 minutes. Riot just wants to be similar. I know hots doesnt have even half as many players as lol but if matchmaking going to be influenced by your performance its something big that riot refused and said its impossible to do for a long time.

Woah, dude. We all agree Riot makes bad decisions, but comparing **any ** gaming company to EA is really offensive!

Um... which old days you talking about... if I remember correctly back in season 3 you could 1v9 with a fed zed/yi/trynd Easily with just 2 or 3 kills. hell a leblanc could win a game singlehandedly in under 25mins. AND THIS WAS SEASON FRIEKEN 3!!! .........hmm I guess you mean the semi-old days of season 5 (cinderhulk) meta, then yes the good semi-old days xD!
I miss the days where people played MAGES on midlane, now its just, assassin here assassin there, fuck my life ..

Why play a anything when you can just go zed, talon, yas, etc etc and just snowball off the couple of bads until you can pubstomp the rest?

Although to be fair AP/mage's have always been more centered around burst damage.
the thing is MOBILITY. You can shutdown a 20/0 xerath pretty easly with coordenation, same cant be said to most assassins, they have so much mobility they can engage and disengage at will

Eh, what it is exactly is debatable and varies from champ to champ, every rock has it's paper and scissors. I think the issue is more centered around the state of the game and how it caters to bads and casuals and favors snowballing. So that you don't have to be good to get fed and become unstoppable.

''So that you don't have to be good to get fed and become unstoppable.''
This resumes LoL right now. I've met enemy teams that i felt were very bad, but they simply had more gold because they got an early gank or something, snowballing the rest of the game.

sad but true. Its not even enjoyable for a single player anymore. Literally one guy gets fed and team groups and finish game. There is no way in solo queue that teams will coordinate to defend base.
Why defend the base? Didn't you know the game is about having a high kda even if you lose?
Right if they defend base they may lose their 4/2/2 kda and then they cant talk about how everyone else fed but they didnt

I've read people's posts here and seen the general discontent and I guess it's time for me to give my two cents

http://downies.com/aca/auction317/aca/images/lots/317/2018.jpg
you should have posted a pic about tencents, it would be the most passive agressive thing ever xd

i dislike the permanent stats you get from dragons.... its game wrecking :/
its much more impactfull and important than baron.

I also dislike the baron buff they introduced few season ago. I hate that baron decides who will take whos inhibitor now. Before baron used to give raw stats now it gives raw stats plus minion push power. It seems so op and hard to defend especially versus paper towell towers.

Gonna get a lot of flak for saying this, but have you tried playing more often with friends instead of alone? I find the experience is much better when done with a group you know and can make jokes with. I find it makes the whole experience much more enjoyable and as a side effect games actually last longer. I promise, if you try playing mostly in groups of friends you'll have a much better time than you currently are.

I can't agree cause I've had alot of fun playing this game solo, being solo or with friends isn't what made this game fun for me it was the hotly contested games that after win or lose made me want to play more, the state of the game now win or loss makes me want to play less

> [{quoted}](name=Doctor Dyment,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Eea9L7ni,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-12-26T09:17:36.110+0000)
>
> Gonna get a lot of flak for saying this, but have you tried playing more often with friends instead of alone? I find the experience is much better when done with a group you know and can make jokes with. I find it makes the whole experience much more enjoyable and as a side effect games actually last longer. I promise, if you try playing mostly in groups of friends you'll have a much better time than you currently are.

Yes and at this point its the ONLY way I can still play league. Because as uber danger once said league is no longer a game I use to have fun. Its a game to be a backdrop when among friends.  Something we can all connect to while apart and talk, joke, laugh while it goes on in the backround as everyone autopilots on their mains or gets carried by the guy auto-piloting while you occasionally try something different.

Riot has stated multiple times that the game is more enjoyable with friends and I agree BUT at what cost? They want to promote gameplay with friends  ever since season 5 and since then the power of solo carries has gone (If a single person gets caught out now you give up sooo much map pressure until you are 5 again), team objectives have gone up, we got dynamic que (which don't get me wrong I enjoyed with friends but as a solo experience it might as well been hell).   As a result the game has become more toxic among solo players and just meh among friends. 

Remember when every game felt different? When there was a trio of team comps for teamfights that kinda worked like rock, paper, scissors? Poke, engage, and wombo combo. You could have a little of all, or two, or invest heavily in a single comp and you knew your win condition.  On top of that there were other strategies like splitpushing and seiging instead of fighting.  

Now EVERY game feels the exact same.  People do so much damage that a single poke champion is enough to be the old poke comp, a single engage is enough to be a wombo combo since people blow up instantly anyways.  Splitpushing is pretty much part of most games but it falls off pretty fast since the mid game disappeared.  

I loved this game. I played way to many games a day and tbh I still would be playing if I could bring myself to look forward to each game.  Now I look at the champ select and it doesn't even matter what champions are on either team.  They game will play out the same way regardless of who gets the lead. 

This game used to be about the overall strategy of your team mixed with the tactics of teamfights and rotations.  Now is all just fast paced tactics.  

So yeah I still play it with friends but it will never compel me to properly learn (read main) new champions and buy their upcoming skins anymore. It will never compel me to play just one more game after a tilting loss and it will never again compel me to get on immediately when I have free time.

> [{quoted}](name=Doctor Dyment,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=Eea9L7ni,comment-id=0003,timestamp=2017-12-26T09:17:36.110+0000)

I promise, if you try playing mostly in groups of friends you'll have a much better time than you currently are.

you know, i used to log in every day, go to messenger just to call my friends to play league and they loved league too. I have at least 5 people to play with incase someone left to do something now,......they are all gone.....all gone...and i can understand why, it used to be so mich fun, playing thresh 1 shotting people with thunderlord and dustblade and shivv, playing like a bonobo and making all your friends laugh. Now it just boring days with a zed that will fuck your adc and mid laner and ganks? nah one q does 1/5  of the jgler hp and then he get double kill then proceed with dustblade and will prob make your team salty and team blame you then u get salty then quit league :|
I do, and we joke but the game is still pretty ass

I don’t miss those days because they never existed in a post-30, gold+ environment.

They always existed, and probably still exist, in pre-30 games.

I have never played any game like that in ranked in any season ever. Then again, my rank was gold in S1 and diamond every season after so maybe my experience is a bit different since higher leveled players know how to close out games.

The worst season imo was the garbage that was the 2nd half of S5 where it only took 1 or 2 ganks for the game to spiral out of control. And for that reason you had stupid junglers whose literal only purpose in life was to gank early that became meta.

I’ve literally never played Panth before then but it was so braindead easy and the snowball was so absolutely ridiculous that even a first time Panth can win games by pressing W. You literally never killed a jg camp past the first buff. You just ganked.

Now THAT is the definition of a bad season.

Hi new player who just started a month ago. 
I dont like the fast paced button mashing blind killing clusterfuck as a main gamemode Its not fun. If I wanted that I would go to a separate game mode.
If I wanted this I would have stayed in p2win paladins for a snowballing hell.  
I came here for a intelligent team based game. Not a pew pew brain dead version. I have gotten more fun from reading the lore than playing the game. 
Get your shit together riot your new playerbase hasn't even been with you during your golden days and we know that its better than this purgatory.  From old to new high to low elo NO ONE LIKES THIS. 
DO YOU EVEN READ YOUR FORMS. All of the heavy top treading forms are saying that this is bs. I get that you cant make everyone happy but jesus Christ. From game play to your damn banning system its all wrecked. If a newcomer is getting irritated I cant imagine how you older players feel.

Riot already stated, sadly, they don't care about the forums anymore. We are a vast minority according to them, which is why they don't really talk to us anymore, let alone put much stock in what we say.

NA to them is a majority, and unless you are Chinese (just being honest), you don't matter to Riot. Riot flat out said we are the minority on this board and they don't care if every person somehow formed the same opinion, they would ignore it all the same. It's just the Riot way to go these days. If someone doesn't agree with you just go "Meh, you are the minority so we can ignore you till you agree or tell us how awesome we are".

honestly so pathetic how businesses can do stuff like this and still have the revenue to not give a shit sadly that's the consumer world we live in, 5 smart people not spending and 50 idiots start buying

Games used to be a back and forth fight of skill and the ability to work with a group. A game would last about 45 minutes, when you won you felt so satisfied. Even when I lost I was happy with my game. Now it’s about getting one kill and getting your tank fed and you win. Riot, fix this

What the fuck are you talking about chances are if you lose the fucking objectives then you shouldn't be able to come back thats how a game should work just cause you think we should have a "fair" game if the game lasts longer than 30 minutes chances are the players dont know how to end the game or are that evenly matched.

he's not talking about all the objectives he's talking about someone getting a slight lead, capitalizing on it then snowballing to the point where you can't win the game because of 1 mistake you or a teammate made in the early game

And from the opposite side of things, why should taking advantage of the opponent’s mistake not be a viable way to close out the game? Why does a team that has a lead need to continuously outplay a team that is behind in order to win?

Why should a team that got outplayed have an equal chance of winning the game?
